definition: upward/up/to advance/to try to improve oneself/to make progress
surname Xiang
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
chin-up (physical exercise)
bottom-up
study hard and every day you will improve (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 hao3 xue2 xi2 , tian1 tian1 xiang4 shang4

sentences.english: Engage your core muscles, then curl your upper body towards a sitting position.
sentences.chinese: 调动人体核心部位的肌肉力量向上抬体，成坐姿。
风筝要以机头向上的姿态结束动作。

sentences.english: Then he looked up and saw the girl at the top of the pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 然后他向上看，看到了宝塔顶端的女孩。

sentences.english: The rear door hinges/is hinged at the top so that it opens upwards.
sentences.chinese: 后面的门是在顶部铰接上的，以便可以向上开。

sentences.english: India from Deccan rivers up to Krishna river system.
sentences.chinese: 来自德干河的印度半岛向上到克里希纳河河流域。

sentences.english: Yad entrance mine market both showed a high consolidation positive trend.
sentences.chinese: 连日来进口矿市场皆呈现出高位盘整向上的趋势。

sentences.english: Using a slotted spoon, transfer apricots, hollow sides up, to a platter.
sentences.chinese: 用细勺将杏肉移至大浅盘中，挖去核的一侧向上。

sentences.english: You could also embed the sideway approach within the top-down or bottom-up approach.
sentences.chinese: 您也可以在自顶向下或自底向上方法中嵌入旁路方法。

sentences.english: The title hopes to go upward, the wall signs thousand Rens, and the jade pillar apex Yao can not climb.
sentences.chinese: 抬头向上望去，壁立千仞，玉柱峰顶遥不可攀。

sentences.english: Under certain conditions, the operator of anomaly separation is simply an upward continuation operator.
sentences.chinese: 在一定条件下，异常划分算子就是向上延拓算子。

sentences.english: Slides easily up the rope and jams when the cam is loaded.
sentences.chinese: 防坠器向上滑动自如，而向下受重时凸轮会制停。

sentences.english: He pushed hard up on the box.
sentences.chinese: 他用力向上推那个箱子。

sentences.english: The two formations make up an upward-deepening transgressive sequence.
sentences.chinese: 两组总体上构成一套向上变深的海侵序列。

sentences.english: My shirt hikes up if I don't wear a belt.
sentences.chinese: 我不束腰带的话，衬衣就会向上滑。

sentences.english: I recorded the measurement and then moved up the branch step-by-step.
sentences.chinese: 我记录下读数再一步一步地向上移动树枝。

sentences.english: Of course, if you were to just keep going, you'd get into the pure liquid phase.
sentences.chinese: 当然，如果你继续向上，你将会进入纯液相。

definition: down/downward
to rise (i.e. number increases)/a price rise/to raise
forward/onward
to disperse/to diverge
(of trains) up (i.e. towards the capital)/(of river boats) to go against the current/to submit (a document) to higher authorities
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
out/outward
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to vibrate/to shake/to shudder
graph of average values
to prop up/to support/strut/brace
(of trains) down (i.e. away from the capital)/(of river boats) to travel downstream/to issue (a document) to lower bureaucratic levels/(of writing on the page) vertical, proceeding from top to bottom
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
(physics) inertia/(fig.) force of habit/tendency to do things in the accustomed way/habitual
half-way line/median line
kinetic energy
moving average index (used in financial analysis)
